page.title: 10Billingham's Development
page.content: Billingham, north of the River Tees, was a small village. In the 1920's a chemical company which became Imperial Chemical Industries (ICI), began production extracting anhydrite deposits from beneath Billingham. Billingham Urban District Council had progressive views in the 1950's and used the wealth generated by the industrial expansion to plan and build a unified new town to the north of the old Billingham.The town provided excellent facilities for the expanding population as well as many new houses.
